storyInfo: Leto tells the Viscount about her past and he is deeply moved. The Trilby Asher begins his investigation aboard the train, and running into Degenbrecher only makes him all the more certain that something is amiss.

attributes.content: In my memories, I see a vast field of snow.
I remember when I was little, I sat on a wooden bed. The fireplace crackled, while a snowstorm blew outside.
The sound of the wind whispered into my ears. There was a large hand stroking my head, and there was someone putting me to bed.
And I drifted off to sleep in that warm, calming sensation.
I used to think that was Ursus.
But Mamochka told me: Nyet, Rosalind, that wasn't Ursus.
That was Kjerag wind.
That was Kjerag snow.
That... was where I was born.
So... It wasn't until you entered secondary school that you learned you were born in Kjerag?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: That's right. Mamochka never told me before. I thought she was kidding at first!
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: I don't remember much of my childhood. All I can picture is snow everywhere... And there's snow everywhere in Ursus, too!
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: How was I supposed to know?
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: Hm, now that you mention it, they are alike in that way.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: However, from what I remember, Ursus is colder than Kjerag.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Hm... That is true. Ursus's colder.
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: Have you been?
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: Hah, many years ago.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: I didn't have much chance to sightsee, though. What a shame!
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Then I'll be your guide the next time you visit.
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: Forget the rest of Ursus, Deity Grypherburg is a sight in itself.
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: Very well, then. Seems I may have to get myself a couple of coats to keep me warm.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: But until I have the opportunity to visit Ursus and take you up on the offer, let me be your guide instead.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: I'll start by telling you about this train's destination—the newly built statue of Kjeragandr.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: It is built atop the island in the middle of Lake Silberneherze. Very conspicuous. You'll see it as soon as you step outside the station.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Of course, for you, the statue is not the point of your trip...
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: You came to Kjerag for something more important than sightseeing.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Yeah, sure did.
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: I need to take a good look at the Kjeragandr statue for my mamochka, though. It's... It's something she stressed before she left us.
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: Then, I'll head up the mountain next to Lake Silberneherze.
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: I need to take the box to the peak.
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: What's inside?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: No idea. She never told me.
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: She just said I had to dump what's inside on the mountain, and that she'd be satisfied if I did.
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: Coming to your foreign homeland all by yourself only to fulfill your mother's wishes...
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: What a kind, faithful daughter! It moves my very soul!
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Eh, that's really too much.
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: What are your plans after that?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: After I take this up the mountain? I'm not too sure. I might travel around.
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: I might... look for my papa.
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: Is your father still in Kjerag?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Perhaps I could offer my assistance in searching for him?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: For real? But I don't even know his name, and I don't remember what he looks like.
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: But Mamochka told me he was very handsome.
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: Aha, a handsome fellow.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Yeah! I guess he used to be a famous, handsome guy. Like, pretty popular, too.
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: Oh, right, and she told me my eyes look just like his.
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: A famous, handsome man from Kjerag? Hm...
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Do you know anybody like that?
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: Hmm...
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: To have a daughter your age, he could only have done the deed while studying in Victoria... Hm...
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: No. No, no, no. That would be far too outrageous...
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Ursus in those days... Could it be...?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Could it be what?
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: Uh, hah, I must give this some more thought.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: I really hope we'll be able to find him.
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: You're hoping for a touching father-daughter reunion?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Ugh.
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: Not exactly.
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: All I want is to see what this bastard who's been gone for over a decade even looks like.
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: Welcome aboard the new Saintess Express. Our train has reached cruising speed. You may appreciate the finest natural sights that Kjerag has to offer through the windows on both sides of the train.
attributes.name: Conductor

attributes.content: During our journey, we have a variety of local Kjerag delicacies available for purchase!
attributes.name: Conductor

attributes.content: From all our favorite treats like yogurt snacks to the ever popular burdenbeast blind boxes, and even Karlan Trade's limited edition mountain ice waters, everything we have on offer is produced locally, handpicked by the Saintess herself, and guaranteed to be of the finest quality!
attributes.name: Conductor

attributes.content: Please feel free to browse our selections...
attributes.name: Conductor

attributes.content: Excuse me. I have a question.
attributes.name: Foreigner With a Funny Hat

attributes.content: Ah, what can I get you today, good sir?
attributes.name: Conductor

attributes.content: I'm not buying anything.
attributes.name: Foreigner With a Funny Hat

attributes.content: These delicacies are not to your fancy? How about this limited edition mountain ice water?
attributes.name: Conductor

attributes.content: This is the Tri-Clan's official drinking water, and it's the Saintess's personal favorite. We don't have many in stock today. A rare opportunity. It can be yours right now for just four francs!
attributes.name: Conductor

attributes.content: Holy Saintess... four francs? I could buy out a restaurant for that price!
attributes.name: Spectating Passenger

attributes.content: It's a little pricey, but just look at the packaging. This clean, pure sensation. It's a perfect fit for your splendid appearance!
attributes.name: Conductor

attributes.content: ...I'll pass.
attributes.name: Foreigner With a Funny Hat

attributes.content: I'll... take a blind box. Thank you.
attributes.name: Foreigner With a Funny Hat

attributes.content: Thank you very much!
attributes.name: Conductor

attributes.content: How long until the next station?
attributes.name: Foreigner With a Funny Hat

attributes.content: This train is a nonstop limited express. The next stop will be the terminus, Lake Silberneherze.
attributes.name: Conductor

attributes.content: We are about two hours from our destination!
attributes.name: Conductor

attributes.content: If you would like to stop somewhere during our journey to better take in the sights along the way, we also offer regular trains that stop at every station on the route!
attributes.name: Conductor

attributes.content: Okay, thank you.
attributes.name: Foreigner With a Funny Hat

attributes.content: You are very welcome.
attributes.name: Conductor

attributes.content: (Blind box? Are these trinkets really so popular?)
attributes.name: Foreigner With a Funny Hat

attributes.content: (It's just a meaningless ornament, no matter how I look at it.)
attributes.name: Foreigner With a Funny Hat

attributes.content: (Still two hours to go. That's more than enough time.)
attributes.name: Foreigner With a Funny Hat

attributes.content: (Next... Hm?)
attributes.name: Foreigner With a Funny Hat

attributes.content: A fowlbeast?
attributes.name: Foreigner With a Funny Hat

attributes.content: (Pecks fiercely)
attributes.name: Runaway Fowlbeast

attributes.content: What...?!
attributes.name: Foreigner With a Funny Hat

attributes.content: (Fly everywhere)
attributes.name: Runaway Fowlbeasts

attributes.content: (Attack all over)
attributes.name: Runaway Fowlbeasts

attributes.content: Gkh—Gkhhh!
attributes.name: Runaway Fowlbeasts

attributes.content: Eh, my fowlbeasts! How did they get out?
attributes.name: Shocked Villager

attributes.content: Where? I'll help you catch them!
attributes.name: Passionate Villager

attributes.content: I'll help, too!
attributes.name: Meddlesome Villager

attributes.content: Mom, I want to catch fowlbeasts!
attributes.name: Mischievous Child

attributes.content: (...Not good.)
attributes.name: Foreigner With a Funny Hat

attributes.content: Hey, mister! Where are you going?
attributes.name: Mischievous Child

attributes.content: Why don't you help?
attributes.name: Mischievous Child

attributes.content: Catching fowlbeasts is so much fun!
attributes.name: Mischievous Child

attributes.content: (Phew.)
attributes.name: Foreigner With a Funny Hat

attributes.content: (To think mere fowlbeasts and a toddler could be so fierce together.)
attributes.name: Foreigner With a Funny Hat

attributes.content: (Seems Kjerag isn't to be underestimated.)
attributes.name: Foreigner With a Funny Hat

attributes.content: (But this does give me a legitimate excuse to check the train cars.)
attributes.name: Foreigner With a Funny Hat

attributes.content: Good afternoon, sirs, have any of you seen any runaway fowlbeasts?
attributes.name: Foreigner With a Funny Hat

attributes.content: No? Thank you. Sorry for disturbing you.
attributes.name: Foreigner With a Funny Hat

attributes.content: (Nothing out of the ordinary here.)
attributes.name: Foreigner With a Funny Hat

attributes.content: (Nothing strange in the car up ahead, either. Only the last few cabins left.)
attributes.name: Foreigner With a Funny Hat

attributes.content: (Looks like this will be another futile journey.)
attributes.name: Foreigner With a Funny Hat

attributes.content: Excuse me, have you...?
attributes.name: Foreigner With a Funny Hat

attributes.content: ...If I find him, I'll make him pay for that decade!
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: Look at this. Before I came here, I had Natalya and Anna—they're my friends, you see. I asked them to help me math all this out.
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: Living expenses, education, medical—oh, and this 'emotional absenteeism' fee that Natalya came up with. It's all here.
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: Doesn't matter how good-looking he is! It's not like that ever fed me!
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: Hahahahaha, emotional absenteeism. Not bad. Very good. I approve!
attributes.name: Harold
Harold
attributes.content: Hm? A guest? Please...

attributes.name: Harold
attributes.content: ...come in...
...Have you seen any escaped fowlbeasts?
attributes.name: Foreigner With a Funny Hat

attributes.content: Fowlbeasts? Oh, I saw one earlier...
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: Ah, right, of course! We did see one!
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Come, come, come, good sir. Let us head outside and discuss that fowlbeast in the greatest detail!
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Huh? What detail is there to a—
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: What the heck? Why are they acting so funny?
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: Hm... Victorians. I hope everything's okay...
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: Alright, kind sir, shall we discuss the fowlbeast?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: I'm very curious what kind of fowlbeast would require a Trilby Asher coming to me in person.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: I did not expect to find you on this train, Lord Viscount.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Oh, please. I could say the very same. Minus the viscount bit.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Why is it that I've never noticed that the Trilby Ashers had such an interest in sightseeing? Or is it that your early retirement has finally been approved?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Seems not.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: No need for the interrogation, My Lord.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: I'm merely doing a routine investigation on certain rumors that I've heard.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Now, I can't say I buy that.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: You and I both help lift the weight off Her Grace. We should have more trust in one another.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: What about you, My Lord? What is your purpose here? And the young lady with you... Is she Ursine?
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: She looks a little familiar.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Trilby Asher...
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: I must say. If that was an attempt to make a move on the lady, it was rather behind the times.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: That is not my intention at all, but thank you for the reminder.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: As for me. I am, of course, sightseeing.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Are you?
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Mind your words now. We should have more trust in one another!
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: The Kjeragandr statue ceremony is in two days. I received an invitation, and I thought I ought to do a little sightseeing before the unveiling.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: I bought two small Saintess sculptures that I am bringing with me on the day. Pretty well-made, if you ask me.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Anyway, enough chit-chat. I see no... 'fowlbeasts' here.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: You should get back to work, Trilby Asher.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: You too, My Lord.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: I hope you haven't forgotten why we're here.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: (This is the last one. Nothing out of the ordinary.)
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: (Except Viscount Craigavon and the girl with him...)
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: (That one traveling with the Viscount... Who exactly is she? It seems I must look into this once I get back.)
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: (But first, I should finish checking this last cabin—)
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Pardon—
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Please excuse me.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Phew...
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: No, that's impossible.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: The intel says she is training new recruits in the mountains. She can't be here.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: She shouldn't be...
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Need something?
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: If you need something, out with it. Or is it so much fun to open random doors?
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: (It really is her...?! The Black Knight who works for the Silverashes...?)
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: (There are bloodstains on her hands. Who forced her hand?)
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: (...This is bad.)
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: (But this also means the intel's not wrong. There's trouble on this route.)
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: No, before I consider that...
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Who are the intelligence officers in charge of watching Degenbrecher...?
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Ah, there we are.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: For them to miss such an important piece of information... They can expect to see a court-martial.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Intelligence officers, you say?
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Don't blame them. There aren't many who can keep up with me.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Thank you for speaking up for them.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: It's the truth.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Now, tell me what you're doing here.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Surely you must have already come up with an excuse or two?
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Trilby Asher?
attributes.name: Degenbrecher
